polymarket_fed_odds.source: POLY N/A fed-decision-in-january no-change-in-fed-interest-rates-after-january-2026-meeting fed-decreases-interest-rates-by-25-bps-after-january-2026-meeting No change Cut 25bp

active_contexts.statement: Jan 27-28 FOMC: pricing proxy skewed to no-change (~88.5% Polymarket snapshot).
active_contexts.market_link: Front-end rates (ZT/ZF) and equity duration (ES/NQ) remain sensitive to data/speaker-driven shifts in near-term policy odds.
active_contexts.notes: Pricing proxy only; monitor catalysts that alter odds distribution.

active_contexts.statement: Fed calendar: Jan 28 decision 2:00pm ET; press conference 2:30pm ET (Jan 27-28 meeting).
active_contexts.market_link: Known timing concentrates intraday volatility around statement/presser across ES/NQ and the Treasury complex.
active_contexts.notes: Calendar anchor; impact depends on policy/communication content.

active_contexts.statement: NY Fed SRF take-up hit record $74.6B on Dec 31 amid year-end funding needs (Reuters).
active_contexts.market_link: Turn-of-year funding dynamics matter for front-end rates; key is whether conditions normalize post-turn.
active_contexts.notes: Reuters framed as calendar-driven rather than a stress signal.

active_contexts.statement: Eurozone Dec final mfg PMI 48.8; Germany final 47.0 with export demand cited as a drag (Reuters).
active_contexts.market_link: EU growth softness can weigh risk tone and support UST duration; also relevant for EUR (6E) and USD (DX).
active_contexts.notes: Final prints; transmission mostly via broad risk sentiment.

watchlist.statement: FOMC member Paulson scheduled to speak Jan 3 and Jan 4 (local calendar); details unknown.
watchlist.market_link: Without topic text, risk is headline/tape sensitivity in ZT/ZN and equity duration (ES/NQ) via reaction-function framing.
watchlist.notes: Low confidence until agenda/remarks are confirmed.

watchlist.statement: Prior US cash close imbalances (Jan 2) were large on the buy side (local feed).
watchlist.market_link: Closing imbalance effects decay quickly but can contextualize late-day ES/NQ volatility and next-session gap sensitivity.

watchlist.statement: Macro baseline: latest CPI core y/y ~3.03% (Sep 2025) and PCE core y/y ~2.83% (Sep 2025).
watchlist.market_link: Inflation baseline informs real-rate sensitivity in ES/NQ and front-end (ZT) when new inflation prints reprice the policy path.
watchlist.notes: Baseline regime framing; data timestamp is Sep 2025 in local snapshot.

upcoming_catalysts.name: FOMC Member Paulson Speaks
upcoming_catalysts.why_it_matters: Any guidance on inflation vs growth balance and the bar for the next move can shift front-end pricing and spill into ES/NQ and USD.

upcoming_catalysts.name: FOMC Member Paulson Speaks
upcoming_catalysts.why_it_matters: Follow-up remarks can clarify reaction-function nuance; market impact depends on whether commentary differs from recent Fed messaging.

upcoming_catalysts.name: FOMC Meeting (Decision/Statement; press conference 2:30pm ET)
upcoming_catalysts.why_it_matters: Scheduled policy decision; reprices front-end expectations and transmits to equities and USD via real-rate and term-premium moves.

headline_memory.headline: NY Fed standing repo operation take-up hit a record $74.6B on Dec 31 (year-end), per Reuters.
headline_memory.why_it_matters: Context for front-end funding/liquidity headlines; watch normalization post turn.

headline_memory.headline: Eurozone Dec final manufacturing PMI 48.8; Germany final 47.0 with export sales weakness highlighted (Reuters).
headline_memory.why_it_matters: EU growth weakness can weigh risk tone and support duration bids in risk-off episodes.

change_log.reason: Re-anchored timing with Fed January 2026 calendar and meeting-schedule press release (2:00pm statement; 2:30pm presser).
Confirmed record $74.6B Dec 31 SRF take-up and calendar-driven framing via Reuters; kept short TTL into early post-turn.
Confirmed Eurozone final 48.8 and Germany final 47.0 with export weakness highlighted via Reuters (Jan 2, 2026).
Previous TTL ended (2026-01-03T16:00:00Z); replaced with shorter watchlist item focused on fast-decaying structural color.
Demoted out due to low near-term relevance vs higher-signal EU PMI and FOMC catalysts; can be re-added if ECB/liquidity headlines emerge.
Low incremental signal and no new confirming headlines in this update; kept focus on higher-impact rates/liquidity drivers.
Lower cross-market impact relative to Eurozone/Germany PMI and US rates catalysts; removed to keep table tight.
